situation.title: Halls of residence
situation.meta_description: The operation of accommodation at university dormitories is limited. Rules and recommendations on school housing.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Due to the pandemic, it is now prohibited to provide accommodation in school educational and accommodation facilities to pupils and students who have their residence elsewhere in the Czech Republic. This also applies to university students.

 

There are exceptions to this. Pupils and students who are staying in dormitories and attend presence education can stay in youth homes and dormitories. Exceptions are also, for example, students participating in the practical training of medical and pedagogical disciplines or working students.

 

I live in a dormitory

 

Pupils and students who have no other residence in the Czech Republic can stay in the dormitories. A residence is a place where you intend to live permanently, a place where you feel at home. If you prove by a statement that you feel at home in the dormitory and not elsewhere, you can continue to stay there.

 

If you stay on the dormitory, follow the increased hygienic measures (Wear Z: disinfect your hands – face mask – social distance).

 

However, the Ministry of Education is asking, if possible, for students and pupils to return to their home, in order to reduce their social contacts. Universities decide on the details of the operation of the dormitories independently. If you have any questions, please contact the dormitory operator directly.

 

If you are in danger of a difficult social situation in connection with this measure, contact your school as universities may award a social scholarship to their students. Financial support is also offered by the Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs.

questions_answers.question: Can I stay in the dorm if I have residence in the Slovak Republic?
questions_answers.value: Yes. The condition is that you do not have a residence in the Czech Republic.

questions_answers.question: Who decides on the opening of university dormitories?
Is residence the same as permanent residence?
questions_answers.value: Residence and permanent residence may or may not be covered. Permanent residence is the so-called "official address", but you determine where you feel at home and that is your residence. For example, if you are registered in Most, but you study / work and live in Prague, where you have friends and hobbies, you will live in Prague.
